title: Cyber Hygiene & Password Safety

sections.title: Creating Secure Passwords
sections.content:
A good password protects your bank account.

- **Strong Password**: A mix of letters (A, b), numbers (1, 2), and symbols (!, @).
- **Weak Password**: Easy to guess (e.g., '123456' or 'password').
- **Change your password**: Update it every few months.
- **Don't share**: Keep your password secret.

sections.title: Digital Safety Habits
sections.content:
Stay safe online with these habits:

- **2FA (Two-Factor Authentication)**: Using your password + a code from your phone.
- **Public Wi-Fi**: Do not use bank apps on free Wi-Fi in cafes or airports.
- **Lock your screen**: Always lock your phone and computer.
- **Phishing**: Be careful with strange emails or links.

sections.title: How 2FA Works
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Enter Password] --> B[Phone receives code]
    B --> C[Enter Code in App]
    C --> D{Identity Verified}
    D -- Yes --> E[Access Granted]
    D -- No --> F[Access Denied]
```

objectives: Recognize the difference between a strong and weak password
Understand the basic concept of 2FA for account security
Identify safe digital habits (Avoiding public Wi-Fi for banking)
